title: How long does it take to self-publish a book? - Quora

response.answer_text: Where do you measure from? You have to edit it. Professionally is preferred but I quite understand why the beginning author doesn’t find it worth the expense. You have to format. You have to proofread again. You need to muck up cover, blurb, bio, TOC, all that other stuff. You need to convert it to the file formats used by the printer and/or electronic market. Some of these take time to do. Some — like hiring an editor or cover artist — take time but it isn’t your time. While you wait for the work to get back to you, you can be busy writing the next book. And oh yes; it will take a lot longer the first time around because you have to study up and learn all this stuff. So, no. Can’t really put a number to it. “A couple of months” if you are doing most of it yourself and you are a fast learner.

I’ve been tracking my progress on my latest book. While it only took me four months to write the story, it took almost six months to edit. If I was writing full time, I could have reasonably published it in 6 months. However, keep in mind, I designed my cover and worked on it simultaneously. If you are doing everything yourself, it might take at least a year. I would say if you are working on it every single day for a minimum of 6 hours a day, you could get in done in 6 months to a year.
